directives.name: DialogDirective
directives.description:
The dialog component is meant to focus user's attention on one particular task or content. It is displayed on top of the rest.

 import { DialogModule } from 'iwerk-angular-ui';

inputsClass.name: clickToClose
inputsClass.description: User can click outside of the dialog to close it.

inputsClass.name: containerClass
inputsClass.description: A class that is added to the container.

inputsClass.name: escToClose
inputsClass.description: User can press Escape to close the dialog.

directives.name: DialogFocusTrapDirective
MultilineEllipsisDirective
directives.description:
The multiline ellipsis directive can be used to display multi-line text with an ellipsis character at the end if the text is too long.

 import { MultilineEllipsisModule } from 'iwerk-angular-ui';

outputsClass.name: truncated
outputsClass.description: An event that is emitted that indicates whether the text is truncated.

getSignature.name: isOverflowing
getSignature.description: A boolean that indicates if the text overflows.

directives.name: PopoverDirective
directives.description:
The popover component can be used to display extra piece of information or more user interface elements. The popover consists in a iw-popover-container that is added directly to the body. It automatically adds a scroll mask element and an arrow element.

Positionning

By default and if possible, the popover is horizontally centered with its target's center. If the popover goes out of bounds, its horizontal position is adjusted to stay in bounds. It is possible to set this horizontal alignment behaviour by setting the horizontalAlignment input to 'leftWithLeft'.

By default, the popover puts itself on top of the target if the target is on the bottom-half of the screen, on the bottom if the target is on the top-half of the screen.

Scroll mask and arrow elements

The popover component automatically appends a scroll mask and an arrow elements to the body. You can adjust their style to your convenience.

  • The arrow is automatically positionned to point at the target element. This element has the class .iw-popover-arrow-element.
  • The scroll mask <iw-popover-scroll-mask> is meant to prevent the user from scrolling and to intercept clicks oustide of the popover and to dismiss the popover.
 import { PopoverModule } from 'iwerk-angular-ui';

inputsClass.name: clickOutsideToClose
inputsClass.description: User can click outside to close the popover. (default: false)

inputsClass.name: escToClose
inputsClass.description: User can press Escape to close. (default: false)

inputsClass.name: popoverClass
inputsClass.description: Specify a class for the popover container.

inputsClass.name: scrollMaskClass
inputsClass.description: Specify a class for the scroll mask.

outputsClass.name: popoverPosition
outputsClass.description: Event triggered when the popover position changes.

outputsClass.name: shouldClose
outputsClass.description: Event triggered that gives you the opportunity to close the popover (e.g. isOpen = false)

directives.name: SbDoingDirective
SbFailureDirective
SbIdleDirective
SbSuccessDirective
StateButtonDirective
TooltipDirective
directives.description:
The tooltip component can be used to display an extra piece of information to an element of an user interface. This piece appears when the mouse is over this element. Add a template that adds the iwTooltip directive inside the element where you want the tooltip to appear.

Positionning

The tooltip is smartly positionned. It will be on top of the target if the target is on the bottom half of the screen. It will be at the bottom of the target if the target is on the top half of the screen.

 import { TooltipModule } from 'iwerk-angular-ui';

inputsClass.name: horizontal
inputsClass.description: Whether the tooltip should be positionned horizontally. (default: false)

components.name: CustomPopoverDemoComponent

styleUrlsData.data:
\:host
  display: block
  max-height: 300px
  width: 200px
  border: 1px solid grey
  border-radius: 3px
  box-shadow: 2px 2px 5px 2px #7b7b7b
  overflow: hidden

  .custom-popover--header
    padding: 0 30px 0 5px
    border-bottom: 1px solid grey
    background-color: lightgrey
    position: relative
    line-height: 30px
    height: 30px

  .custom-popover--content
    padding: 15px 5px
    background: white

  .custom-popover--close-button
    position: absolute
    right: 5px
    top: 0
    line-height: 30px
    text-decoration: none
    cursor: pointer

    &:hover
      color: black
